unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Boost Adoption in Maharashtra**
normalised: Energy and Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Boost Adoption in Maharashtra

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – The Maharashtra Energy Development Agency (MEDA) announced increased subsidies for residential solar rooftop installations, aiming to accelerate the state's renewable energy transition. The revised scheme offers subsidies up to 40% for systems up to 3 kW, benefiting individual households significantly.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – The Maharashtra Energy Development Agency (M E D A) announced increased subsidies for residential solar rooftop installations, aiming to accelerate the state's renewable energy transition. The revised scheme offers subsidies up to forty percent for systems up to three kilowatt, benefiting individual households significantly.

unnormalised: Dr. Anil Kumar, Director of MEDA, stated, "This enhanced incentive will make solar power more accessible to middle-class families, reducing their electricity bills and dependence on conventional sources." The subsidy is capped at Rs. 78,000 per installation for systems exceeding 3kW but below 10kW.
normalised: Doctor Anil Kumar, Director of M E D A, stated, "This enhanced incentive will make solar power more accessible to middle-class families, reducing their electricity bills and dependence on conventional sources." The subsidy is capped at rupees seventy eight thousand per installation for systems exceeding three kilowatt but below ten kilowatt.

unnormalised: Under the "Surya Ghar Yojana," eligible homeowners can avail the benefits for rooftops with a minimum area of 200 sq ft. Experts predict this move will encourage widespread adoption, particularly in cities like Pune and Nagpur, leading to a substantial reduction in carbon emissions. Further details and application procedures are available on the MEDA website.
